The Plane Stress &equation; is
\[ \sigma_{iz} = 0 \]
where \(\sigma_{ij}\) is the . It has three components, for \(i=x,y,z\). Activating the Plane Stress equation is one way to reduce a three dimensional problem to two dimensions. A system in plane stress can have out-of-plane strains but no out-of-plane forces, so it is equivalent to a thin free standing membrane in the x-y plane. The three components of the plane stress equation add three constraints to each &node; of the &mesh;, corresponding to the three z-derivatives, Displacement_z, of the &field; which have to be solved for.
